column4: Can anyone help me get Edgy64 working (i.e. not crashing) on my "Core 2 Duo" laptop. At the moment, any ACPI event (lid close, ac, ...) causes a crash with no error message.
If I disable acpi (or use acpi=noirq), it no longer crash, but it's not very useful, since I can't use the second core.
Anyone's had problems with the screen not turning back on when closing the lid.
Do you mean when opening the lid (of a laptop)
what happens when you press a key or power button?
The machine is normal otherwise. I can do a blind Ctrl-Alt-F1 and type init 6 and it reboots
have to had a look around in System-> Power Management?
Even if I tell it not to do anything on lid close, the screen still goes blank. Actually, closing the lid in single-user mode does the same.
that's odd.  Maybe some issue with a driver, or even you laptop has a hardware deafults to turn screen off when it is closed.
when I close the lid in grub, it goes blank and turns back on when I open it. It's only once Linux has booted that it doesn't do that anymore.
do you know what happens exactly (sequence of events) when one closes the lid on a laptop?
I don't know sorry.  You could have a look at /etc/acpi/lid.sh and related files.
does it make a difference if you are running on battery or not?
BTW vbetool dpms seems to work fine
I don't think i can help you with it then.  Maybe try in #gnome?
It's not a gnome problem. It happens even in the console, in single-user mode
Any idea why X would crash when I do a lid close/open? If I do it while in a console, it works.
